title: Manchester United 'in talks' with major brands for mega-money sponsorship deal
text:
Manchester United are reportedly in talks with a host of major global brands over becoming the club's new shirt sponsor.

United are currently sponsored by American car manufacturer Chevrolet, who agreed a seven-year deal worth £450 million back in 2014.

That figure was a record sum paid by a brand for a football shirt sponsorship deal and was double the amount paid by previous sponsors Aon.

Manchester United are in negotiations with a host of brands over a new shirt sponsorship deal

United's current seven-year deal with Chevrolet is worth a record £450m and ends in 2021

United's executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward is confident a new deal will surpass that sum

Despite Chevrolet's incredible investment, United are confident of securing a deal that will match or even surpass that sum, according to Sky Sports.

Chevrolet's deal doesn't expire until 2021 but the Premier League club are wasting no time in lining up a potential new sponsor.

It's believed United have already opened negotiations with a series of global brands over a deal which would provide a further boost to United's swelling coffers.

PREMIER LEAGUE SHIRT DEALS: 2019/20 VALUE CLUB VALUE Man United £64m Man City £45m Arsenal £40m Chelsea £40m Liverpool £40m

Last month the club revealed record-breaking revenues of £627.1 million for the year ending June 30, 2019, which represented a 6% rise on the previous year.

In response to news of a potential new sponsor, a United spokesman released a statement on Thursday endorsing their current deal with Chevrolet.

'Chevrolet is a fantastic partner. The sponsorship continues to achieve its objectives for both parties and we will continue to work to activate and maximise it.'

United's chief executive, Ed Woodward, also revealed recently the importance of the club's shirt sponsorship deal in providing funds to invest in the playing squad.
description: Manchester United are reportedly in talks with a host of major global brands over becoming the club's new shirt sponsor. United's seven-year £450m deal with Chevrolet expires in 2021.
